metadata.title: CVE-2021-23222 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A man-in-the-middle attacker can inject false responses to the client'sfirst few queries, despite the use of SSL certificate verification andencryption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3').
